@gunan - To confirm: on the docker container for the GPU tests, libcudnn.so is installed under /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu and not /usr/local/cuda/lib64? Is this expected?

This seems odd to me since Dockerfile.gpu seems to specify that libcudnn.so is also installed under /usr/local/cuda/lib64:

ENV CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH /usr/local/cuda
body:
@gunan - To confirm: on the docker container for the GPU tests, `libcudnn.so` is installed under `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu` and not `/usr/local/cuda/lib64`? Is this expected?

This seems odd to me since [`Dockerfile.gpu`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/73ced9d797056c7e67a06ed2098dd809d85ec44a/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/Dockerfile.gpu#L25) seems to specify that `libcudnn.so` is also installed under `/usr/local/cuda/lib64`:

``` dockerfile
ENV CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH /usr/local/cuda
```
